front.title: Address autoconfiguration for MANETs: definition and problem statement

abstract.t: A Mobile Ad Hoc NETwork (MANET) is formed by the association of mobile devices, usually wireless and capable of multi-hop communication among themselves even if there is no networking infrastructure available. MANET properties such as multi-hop, autonomous, etc requires separate address autoconfiguration mechanism. This document provides definition, problem statement and goals for ad hoc networks address autoconfiguration.
